content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 11 Oct 2018If I plan to invest in the S&P500 which ETF index fund should I buy in the US stock market?With the recent market movements in the US. I am thinking of buying into the US ETF market. Also thinking which platform do people use most of the time? I was considering DBS Vickers but was wondering if there were any charges involved beyond the brokerage fees? Thank you!3 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 11 Oct 2018Buy ireland domicilied etf listed on london stock exchange. Withholding tax will drop from 30% to 15% much better. Go for CSPX for purely S&P500 or you can go for IWDA for world etf more diversification. CSPX also accumulate dividends back into the fund so you wont receive any dividends but the share price will increase more. You can go look at standard chartered also not bad.0 comments1

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 11 Oct 2018For US index:​SPY (SPDR S&P 500 ETF) - https://www.investopedia.com/markets/etfs/spy/​VOO (Vanguard S&P 500 ETF) - https://www.investopedia.com/markets/etfs/voo/​For world indexes:​VWRD (Vanguard FTSE All-World ETF) - https://sg.finance.yahoo.com/quote/VWRD.L/​IWDA (iShares Core MSCI World UCITS ETF) - https://www.bloomberg.com/quote/IWDA:LN​​0 comments0

Christopher HowLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 11 Oct 2018VWRD and IWDA will be good options as they are not based in US and are not subjected to US taxes. If you invest in VWRL for example, it's technically the same thing but based in US so you get taxed by the US.0 comments0
